question_text: What role does a load balancer play in ensuring service uptime?
answer_options: It redirects all traffic to a single backup server
It provides firewall inspection for incoming emails
It distributes client requests across multiple servers
It maintains DNS records across subnets
correct_answer: It distributes client requests across multiple servers
explanation: By distributing traffic, a load balancer prevents any one server from becoming overloaded and helps maintain consistent service availability.
